description:
Update the UI with these improvements, this is for the recipes page but some of it may apply throughout the layout:  

What’s working really well

Information density is solid: cards show name + key stats without drowning you.

Top nav + left nav separation makes sense: “domain tabs” up top, “workspace actions” on the left.

Filters + search row is the right pattern for recipe libraries.

The card layout reads fast: image → title → metadata is the right scan order.

What’s costing you clicks / attention

The left sidebar is heavy. It’s visually dominant, and the actual work area feels slightly boxed-in. (The app looks like it has two “frames”: sidebar + inner bordered canvas.)

Real-world effect: users feel like they’re operating inside a smaller window than they actually are.

“Cleanup imports” is top-right and loud-ish, but it’s a rare/admin action.

Real-world effect: it competes with daily actions like “Add Recipe” and filters. It should probably live under a kebab menu / admin tools.

The recipe cards look a bit “same-y” once you have dozens. The repeated “Yield/Prep/Ingredients/Linked dishes/Status” layout is good, but the eye needs stronger anchors.

Real-world effect: users take longer to find the one they want, even if search exists.

Two high-impact improvements (cheap, big payoff)

Make the card title the visual hero

Increase title size/weight slightly, or add a subtle divider.

Right now the title competes with the image area and the meta lines.

Make the “Add image / paste image” affordance feel more intentional

That “Click to paste image from clipboard” strip looks like an input field.

Better as a button/dropzone with an icon + clear border state.

Real-world effect: fewer “is this editable?” hesitation moments.

One “this will annoy real users” detail

You’ve got two navigation systems + inner breadcrumbs + inner tabs:

top domain tabs (Events/Kitchen/Warehouse/etc)

left nav (Dashboard/Inbox/Kitchen/etc + Production)

breadcrumb (Kitchen Ops > Recipes & Menus)

inner tabs (Recipes/Dishes/Menus/Ingredients/Costing)

This is organized, but it’s also a lot of navigation chrome.
Real-world effect: users sometimes feel lost: “Where am I? Which nav changes what?”

Fix without redesign: collapse one layer visually.
Example: make breadcrumbs smaller/lighter, or remove one nav label layer when inside Kitchen.

Overall vibe

8/10 foundation. It’s already “shippable,” but you’re one polish pass away from it feeling premium instead of competent.
title: Simplify recipes UI with card hierarchy improvements
